div.ab: zōt ud rāspīg: Anklesaria, Kotwal and Boyd, Geldner.

Parallels.ab: vīspā̊ frauuaṣ̌aiiō aṣ̌āunąm yazamaide = VrS30.10, VrS51.5, VrS51.6.

iristanąm uruuąnō yazamaide yā̊ aṣ̌āunąm frāuuaṣ̌aiiō = Y26.6, Y71.24, VrS18.5, VrS30.11, VrS36.5, VrS41.6, VrS51.8, VrS57.8, VrS62.8, VrS64.9, VrS65.82, VrS69.8, VrS71.8, VrS87.12, VrS93.11; ~ Y16.7 iristanąm uruuąnō š́āiieṇti yā̊ aṣ̌āunąm frāuuaṣ̌aiiō.

ModernPractice.ab: "The chief priest, after filling up the perforated saucer from the water container with the right hand, puts (it) on the cup near the base of the moon-shaped stands. iristanąm uruuąnō yazamaide yā̊ aṣ̌aonąm frauuaṣ̌aiiō yeŋ́hē hātąm.

ab.ab: "As both priests recite st. 11, "We revere the souls of the departed who are of the holy guardian spirits" (iristanām urvānō yazamaidē yāo ashaonām fravashayō), the zōt takes the nine-holed sieve (sūrākhdār tashta) from the water basin and moves it slowly across the table, dripping water, and places it on top of the cup beside the barsom stand."
